text: Does anyone maybe have an idea why my custom module shows the correct blog pagination, but does not actually truncate to the correct amount set in the settings for maximum of posts per page?
I do have "for content in contents" in both the blog listing loop and the pagination
I see two cookies that might be related - check where those are loading from.
Hmmm... I wonder if its coming from this that I see at the bottom of the page source:

I’ll check the cookies. About that tracking code I don’t think so because it’s from Hotjar and the tracking code that is showing is from G2, they are 2 different platforms. I can try removing Hotjar tracking code anyway. Thank you

Hi people :slightly_smiling_face: having lots of issues regarding data quality control in a new implementation of HubSpot, users are running imports of contacts with just names which causes a huge duplicates headache. We can of course tell our users not to but there are always going to be cases when someone ignores the rules. We have been advised by our partner that there is no way of setting mandatory fields on an objects which would enforce a minimum set of fields for an import is that true? and if it is how on earth do people manage this? :face_exhaling:
You can create different permission sets and set your users to abide by those permissions - including not allowing them to import if you choose.
We want them to be able to import, we just want basic controls on the data i.e. to import a contact you NEED a first name, last name and email

Hello <#C22PU4LV8|general>, what's the best possible approach to pull HubSpot data to Microsoft Ecosystem(like fabric lakehouse)?

please advice.
Training, training, training if you want to control that.  I would vote for only allowing SOME users to import - not anyone.  But that's me.

There is a marketplace app that says it can sync HubSpot data with various data store including Microsoft Azure Data Warehouse - I think you can import to Lakehouse from the Data Warehouse.  Please note I know nothing about this app, have never used it and I am not affiliated with the company at all.  Just providing information for you.
Even the best employee can slip and hit go on a badly configured import with big implications.... Insane to me that HS doesn't have basic mandatory field controls seem like a huge oversight
you can submit an idea in the community pages and hope it gets enough upvotes - maybe some else already has so search first <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/idb-p/HubSpot_Ideas>

I'd say marketplace apps are great when it comes to ease of use - but if you have specific requirements or the marketplace app doesn't meet your requirement the best way would be to start looking would be something like zapier - or you could develop your own integration with the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/overview|HubSpot APIs>

Hello <#C22PU4LV8|general>, I have create public app which I verified and its working fine in dev test account, question - how can I promote the app to Sandbox or Production account for verification?

any doc to follow.

Hello all, my client is having all kinds of random issues this morning (gateway errors, app.css not loading... etc.) which isn't looking great (they just signed on for the enterprise CMS and are launching tomorrow). The latest one is that they can randomly see HubL in the page editor for no reason. Is anyone else experiencing anything like that?

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!

Hello :wave: ,
Not sure which channel is best to ask this - what’s best practice to backup HubSpot? Something that will also allow us to rollback incase data gets corrupt.
Hi all, anyone know how I can store raw html in a CRM property (the Rich Text type is very limited in terms of tags)?
Hello every one, I am Erwin. It is my first time on HubSpot slack channel.

I look forward to your selfless assistance.
Thanks.
